poem:
### Grey Plover Metamorphosis

From Arctic whispers, stout and grey,  
Unnoticed in the coastal fray.  
Yet come the spring, a shift begins—  
A cloak of colour, life within.  
Unshowy name, a heart untamed,  
Bold patterns drawn, the world proclaimed.  
A quiet bird with stories spun,  
Underneath the warming sun.
